thread.title: Orlando Police Officer Killed; Manhunt Underway
thread.title_full: Orlando Police Officer Killed; Manhunt Underway

author: CBS Philly
title: Orlando Police Officer Killed; Manhunt Underway
text:
Orlando Police Officer Killed; Manhunt Underway January 9, 2017 10:28 AM Filed Under: Orlando Police , shooting 
By AnneClaire Stapleton and Holly Yan 
ORLANDO, Fla. (CNN)–An Orlando police officer was killed Monday and a manhunt is under way for the gunman who shot her, the Orlando Police Department said. 
“The Orlando Police Department family is heartbroken today,” OPD tweeted along with video of a flag-draped casket. “One of our own was taken in the line of duty. There are no words.” 
The department identified the slain officer as Master Sgt Debra Clayton, a 17-year veteran of the force. BREAKING: Orlando police officer shot multiple times outside Walmart; suspect on the run https://t.co/hECQav0Jah pic.twitter.com/Jpa9LmJtEx 
— CBS News (@CBSNews) January 9, 2017 
Authorities have identified the suspect as Markeith Loyd. 
At least 14 schools are on lockdown as the manhunt continues, Orange County Public Schools said. 
Authorities say a deputy sheriff was also killed on Monday in motorcycle crash while searching for man Loyd, the Associated Press reports.
